definitions.body: vapour, breath (NH id., Syr. ha0 id.) fig. vanity (so NH, Syr. habolo0:)—[[הָָבֶל]] Ec 1:2 +; cstr. [[הֲבֵל]] † Ec 1:2, Ec 1:2, Ec 12:8, sf. [[הֶבְלִי]] etc. Ec 6:12, Ec 7:15, Ec 9:9, Ec 9:9; pl. [[הֲבָלִים]] Je 10:8 +; cstr. [[הַבְלֵי]] Je 8:19 +, sf. [[הַבְלֵיהֶם]] De 32:21 +;—

lit. Is 57:13 all of them (the idols) [[יִשָּׂא־רוּחַ יִקַּח הָָבֶל]] a breath (Vulgate aura) will carry away, Pr 21:6 the getting of treasures by a lying tongue is [[הֶבֶל]] [[נִדָּף]] a vapour driven away. Elsewhere always

fig. of what is evanescent, unsubstantial, worthless, vanity, as of idols Je 10:15 = Je 51:18, Je 16:19 [[הֶבֶל וְאֵין בָּם מוֹעִיל]] (‖[[שֶׁקֶר ]]) , heathen observances Je 10:3, and in phr. [[הָלַךְ אַחֲרֵי הַהֶבֶל]] Je 2:5, 2Ki 17:15; Pr 13:11 [[הוֹן מֵהֶבֶל]] wealth (gotten) out of vanity, (i.e. not by solid toil, opp. [[קׂבֵץ]] [[עַל יׇד]]) is minished (but LXX Vulgate Ew [[מְבׂהָל]], v. Pr 20:21 Qr), Pr 31:30 [[שֶׁקֶר וְהֶבֶל הַיּׁ֑פִי]], La 4:17 [[אֶל עֶזְרָתֵנוּ]] [[הֶבֶל]] to our vain (Dr:§ 193 n.) help; of life Job 7:16 :[[כִּי הֶבֶל יׇמָֽי]], Ps 78:33 [[וַיְכַל בַּהֶבֶל יְמֵיהֶם]] consumed their days as ([[בְּ]]

definitions.title: 1:7 d
definitions.body: vanity, man Ps 39:6, Ps 39:12, Ps 62:10 :[[הֵמָּה מֵהֶבֶל יׇחַֽד]]…[[הֶבֶל בְּנֵי אָדָם ]] they are altogether (made) of vanity, Ps 94:11, Ps 144:4, esp in Ec (31 t. + [[הֲבֵל הֲבָלִים]] Ec 1:2, Ec 1:2, Ec 12:8) of the fruitlessness of all human enterprise and endeavour, Ec 1:2 [[הַכּׂל]] [[הֶבֶל]], v:Ec 1:14 [[הַכּׂל הֶבֶל וּרְעוּת רוּחַ]] all was vanity and the pursuit of wind, Ec 2:1, Ec 2:14, Ec 2:15 etc., Ec 6:4 (of an abortion) [[בַּהֶבֶל בָּא]] i.e. into a lifeless existence, v:Ec 6:11 [[יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים הַרְבֵּה מַרְבִּים הָָבֶל]] (of discussions leading to no result), note also the phrases [[יְמֵי]] ([[הֶבְלוֹ]], [[הֶבְלְךָ]]) [[הֶבְלִי]] Ec 7:15, Ec 9:9, ´[[יְמֵי חַיֵּי ה]] Ec 6:12, Ec 9:9; Job 27:12 (v. [[הָבַל]]), Is 49:4 [[לְתׂהוּ וׇהֶבֶל]] for nought and vanity have I spent my strength; as adv. accus. vainly, to no purpose Is 30:7 [[הֶבֶל וׇרִיק יַעֲזׁ֑רוּ]], Ps 39:7 [[אַךְ הֶבֶל יֶהֱמָיוּן]] they disquiet themselves to no purpose, Job 9:29: [[הֶבֶל אִיגׇֽע]] Job 35:16, with [[נִחַם]] to comfort Job 21:34, Zec 10:2. Pl. † [[הֲבָלִים]] of false gods, De 32:21 [[כִּעֲסוּנִי בְהַבְלֵיהֶם]] ( ‖[[בְּלאׁ־אֵל ]]) 1Ki 16:13, 1Ki 16:26, Je 8:19 [[הַבְלֵי נֵכָר]] (‖[[בִּפְסִילֵיהֶם ]]), Je 10:8, Je 14:22 [[הַבְלֵי הַגּוֹיִם]], Ps 31:7 [[הַשּׁׂמְרִים הַבְלֵי־שָׁוְא]] empty vanities Jon 2:9; in more general sense Ec 1:2, Ec 1:2, Ec 12:8 [[הֲבֵל הֲבָלִים]], Ec 5:6.
